basics.name: Abiodun Modupe
basics.label: Lecturer & Coordinator/Research Scientist
basics.summary: I am an academic and a researcher with interest in NLP. I have a PhD and nearly ten years of work experience. I am a co-founder of HausaNLP and Arewa Data Science. My research specializes in natural language processing in low-resource settings, focusing on addressing data insufficiency in various NLP applications and solving complex problems with limited data. I aim to bring innovative, data-driven solutions to NLP challenges in a corporate environment.

work.name: University of Pretoria, Pretoria. South African
work.summary: Conduct research at the intersection of AI, with a focus on NLP, computer vision, and cybersecurity, and have 6+ years of experience providing technical leadership in machine learning and data infrastructure. I have a proven track record of managing million-dollar AI research initiatives and leading or collaborating with teams of researchers to develop innovative ML systems for NLP challenges.
highlights: Led curriculum design, supervised research projects, and served as Big Data degree coordinator
Published multiple papers in top-tier NLP conferences and journals.
Developed multiple funding proposals for research projects.

publications.name: Cross-lingual embedding methods and applications: A systematic review for low-resourced scenarios
publications.summary: This study presents a systematic review of cross-lingual transfer learning (CLTL) techniques, focusing on their foundations, applications, evaluation methods, language coverage, and recent advances, and highlighting future research directions for low-resource NLP.

publications.name: Mafoko: Structuring and Building Open Multilingual Terminologies for South African NLP
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Sixth Workshop on Resources for African Indigenous Languages (RAIL), Co-located with DHASA2025
publications.summary: IThe study introduces Mafoko, a RAG-based framework that consolidates South Africa’s fragmented terminology into open datasets, improving translation accuracy and advancing equitable multilingual NLP technologies that better showcase the country’s linguistic diversity.
